Message.Title: AMZN at PE of 318 unsustainable
Message.Msg: AMZN's extremely high PE is said to be because of very high technology expenses to generate revenue growth with the expectation that when they reduce technology expenditures profit margins will increase. They plan to add more warehouses to support same day delivery so that means expenditures are not going to go away for a while so AMZN will continue to report losses and negative cash flow and PE will keep rising. Stock buyers are putting a bet that when they do reduce expenditures PE will come down but it may still be too high. Besides when they reduce expenditures it's safe to assume that revenue growth will decline also. So then the question would be would investors still pay a premium on PE if revenues don't grow as much? It's very iffy business model (spend today, reap profits tomorrow - but what environment is different tomorrow and and those expectations are not realized). To generate more revenues, they are selling Fire devices at cost or even below cost when you factor in S&A expenses. Also, California will add sales tax on Internet sales and that will spread to other states - no one knows how this would negatively affect AMZN's sales. In cloud tecg area there are other competitors so any future growth is speculative and not guaranteed given we are in a global competitive world. So the risk/reward ratio is definitely turning very negative for AMZN on valuation basis. Yes, momentum has carried it this far, but now we are at a point of diminishing return - everything has a limit.
